subject: Re: [junit] testing private methods
msgSnippet: This is often discussed, and probably doesn t need further elaboration in this list on this date.  JUnit works best when it is used to test how the clients of
messageBody:
This is often discussed, and probably doesn't need further elaboration
in this list on this date. JUnit works best when it is used to test
how the clients of your class will see it operate, which of course
excludes the direct implementation of private methods.

That said, asking Google about "testing private methods" is likely to
give you some ideas of whether, and how, to do such a thing.

David Saff

On Nov 30, 2007 7:01 AM, choi_chandima <choi_chandima@...> wrote:
> please kindly let me know how to test a private method in a class
> using junit.I use netbeans as my development environment to which
> Junit is integrated, Once i create the test package for concrete
> classes all test skeltons of public methods appear in junit test class
> but not the private methods
> thanx
